content:
• Tuesday, June 11, 2013
  • DS

    Newcastle Investment (NCT) announces a 30M share public offering, with a 30 day option for an...

    Newcastle Investment (NCT) announces a 30M share public offering, with a 30 day option for an additional 4.5M shares. The company plans to use the net proceeds to make a variety of investments, primarily acquisitions of senior housing properties, but could also include CDO debt, other real estate securities and loans, operating businesses or other assets. Shares -1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals's (NASDAQ:ARNA) ticks higher in the post-session after its CEO told CNBC...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals's (NASDAQ:ARNA) ticks higher in the post-session after its CEO told CNBC he sees its obesity drug Belviq as "transformative." (Video). Shares +2.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 PM
  • IEP

    Icahn Enterprises (NYSE:IEP) announces a public offering of depositary units representing...

    Icahn Enterprises (NYSE:IEP) announces a public offering of depositary units representing limited partner interests in Icahn Enterprises. The proceeds from the offering will be used solely for the recapitalization of Federal-Mogul (NASDAQ:FDML). Credit Suisse, UBS and Jefferies are acting as the joint book-running managers. Shares -5.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM
  • CLSN

    Shares of Celsion (NASDAQ:CLSN) are getting slammed in the post session on the back of a Seeking...

    Shares of Celsion (NASDAQ:CLSN) are getting slammed in the post session on the back of a Seeking Alpha blog saying that the recent runup in its share price, based largely on hopes that the recently presented post-hoc analysis would show that the Phase III ThermoDox HEAT trial wasn't a complete failure, was unwarranted. Alpha Exposure says that after speaking at length with doctors that participated in the study, it was in fact, a total failure. Thermodox has no chance of regulatory approval. The financial blogger puts a price tag of $0.73 on the shares. Shares -19% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 3 Comments
  • RMBS

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RMBS +8%. ULTA +8%. LND +5%. BNNY +5%. Z +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RMBS +8%. ULTA +8%. LND +5%. BNNY +5%. Z +3%.
    After-hours top losers: IEP -5%. FSLR -4%. BCOV -3%. GOL -3%. NCT -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) -4.1% AH after filing an automatic mixed shelf. The solar giant had...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) -4.1% AH after filing an automatic mixed shelf. The solar giant had $1.01B in cash/investments and $562M in debt on its balance sheet as of March 30.   (S-3)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • ULTA

    More on Ulta Salon's (NASDAQ:ULTA) Q1: Sales and EPS rise 22.9% and 20.4% Y/Y respectively while...

    More on Ulta Salon's (NASDAQ:ULTA) Q1: Sales and EPS rise 22.9% and 20.4% Y/Y respectively while comps growth comes in at 6.7%. The company opens 28 new stores during the period and repurchases 500.5K shares of stock. CEO Dennis Eck is "pleased" and calls the results "better than expected." Outlook: ULTA sees Q2 EPS of $0.64-0.67 on net sales of $579-589M versus consensus of $0.68/share on revenue of $590M. Shares +7.58% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) +9% AH after announcing a patent license deal with DRAM giant and long-time...

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) +9% AH after announcing a patent license deal with DRAM giant and long-time legal adversary SK Hynix. The deal settles "all outstanding claims," and will net Rambus DRAM license payments of $12M/quarter for the next 5 years; other terms are confidential. CC at 5PM ET (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • EXM

    Excel Maritime (NYSE:EXM) is hardly the only dry bulk stock with problems, Wells Fargo says,...

    Excel Maritime (NYSE:EXM) is hardly the only dry bulk stock with problems, Wells Fargo says, seeing "substantial" long-term Chapter 11 or refinancing risk at Genco (GNK -2.8%), DryShips (DRYS -2.4%) and Eagle Bulk Shipping (EGLE -3.3%). The firm thinks it's too early for a sustainable recovery in the dry bulk market, with balance sheet risk a more likely near-term result than any fundamental recovery. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • XIDEQ

    Exide (XIDE +20%) gets interim court approval of a variety of motions towards its restructuring,...

    Exide (XIDE +20%) gets interim court approval of a variety of motions towards its restructuring, including the approval of its $500M Debtor-in-Possession financing agreement with JPMorgan Chase to continue the uninterrupted operation of its global business. Standard & Poors cuts its rating to D on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • INCY

    Shares of Incyte (INCY -1.8%) came under a bit of pressure earlier after Morgan Stanley put out...

    Shares of Incyte (INCY -1.8%) came under a bit of pressure earlier after Morgan Stanley put out a note pointing out Jakafi's withdraw syndrome side effect in a recent case report from the Journal of Clinical Oncology. Morgan thinks additional safety events will skew risk/benefits of the drug, eventually limiting it to primarily treating 'sicker' myelofibrosis patients. The firm currently has an Underweight rating on the stock with a price target of $14.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • MRIN

    Marin Software (MRIN +2.9%) heads back above $11 after announcing it has hired accomplished...

    Marin Software (MRIN +2.9%) heads back above $11 after announcing it has hired accomplished online ad marketing vet Matt Ackley to be its chief marketing officer. Ackley was once responsible for product/industry marketing for Google's display ad ops (including its DoubleClick unit, which competes with Marin). He was did a stint as eBay's VP of advertising and internet marketing. Marin remains down 20% from its March IPO price of $14, following an unfavorable reaction to its May Q1 report. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • CDE

    Coeur d'Alene Mines (CDE -1.5%) reaffirms its 2013 production guidance of 18M-19.5M oz. of...

    Coeur d'Alene Mines (CDE -1.5%) reaffirms its 2013 production guidance of 18M-19.5M oz. of silver and 250K-265K oz. of gold; cash operating costs per silver oz. are expected at $9.50-$10.50, using a gold by-product price assumption of $1,500 for the last nine months of 2013. Kensington’s cash operating costs per gold oz. are seen at $900-$950.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • GDOT

    BTIG flips the bear case on Green DOT (GDOT -2.3%) on its head by noting the company's deep...

    BTIG flips the bear case on Green DOT (GDOT -2.3%) on its head by noting the company's deep relationship with Wal-Mart is just as much of an asset as it is an overhang with a key contract set to expire in 2015. The firm keeps a Buy rating in place on GDOT and takes its price target up to $23. If news of a Green Dot contract renewal with Wal-Mart hits the tape, the investment firm says watch for a pop.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (DMND +10.5%) trades higher following better-than-expected FQ3 results. During the...

    Diamond Foods (DMND +10.5%) trades higher following better-than-expected FQ3 results. During the firm's conference call (transcript), execs minimized recent communications with the SEC, saying the only recent comment letters from the agency concerned segment reporting. On the question on if the SEC wants more writedowns, interim CFO Michael Murphy says that "doesn't ring a bell."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • UQM

    UQM Technologies (UQM +22.8%) shares jump as the company signs a new long-term supply agreement...

    UQM Technologies (UQM +22.8%) shares jump as the company signs a new long-term supply agreement with Electric Vehicles International to extend vehicle electrification work the companies have done together. EVI will use UQM PowerPhase HD systems to power their all-electric walk-in vans and medium-duty commercial trucks.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • COCO

    BofA analyst David Chu wants you to remember that today's SEC subpoena news (8-K) isn't the only...

    BofA analyst David Chu wants you to remember that today's SEC subpoena news (8-K) isn't the only thing to worry about at Corinthian Colleges (COCO -11.8%), but it does create an additional "overhang." Without a revision to its financial responsibility score, the company may need to raise $176M in cash, he says. Chu is presumably referring to a dispute involving the treatment of a $203.6M goodwill impairment charge in the fiscal year ended June 30, 2011. See page 23 of the latest 10Q for more.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • LULU

    Goldman's Lindsay Drucker Mann weighs in on Lululemon (LULU -16.5%), calling slowing comp trends...

    Goldman's Lindsay Drucker Mann weighs in on Lululemon (LULU -16.5%), calling slowing comp trends a "sign of natural aging" as mature Canadian stores appear "to have neared a ceiling." Although the company may age gracefully, slower growth "could lead to a re-rate lower from LULU's 35- 40x P/E range," Drucker Mann adds. (Earlier: Here come the LULU downgrades)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • SGOC

    Midday top 10 gainers: SGOC +56%. BEAT +53%. UQM +30%. PGNX +26%. DOLE +21%. NOA +21%. QCOR...

    Midday top 10 gainers: SGOC +56%. BEAT +53%. UQM +30%. PGNX +26%. DOLE +21%. NOA +21%. QCOR +20%. VNDA +19%. ALTI +13%. CMGE +13%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: GNMK -23%. LULU -17%. SMA -16%. ALVR -15%. LDK -10%. PRIS -10%. RSOL -10%. OTCPK:IMUC -9%. OTC:ECTE -9%. COCO -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • GNMK

    Shares of GenMark Diagnostics (GNMK -25%) get slammed after one of its customers, Natural...

    Shares of GenMark Diagnostics (GNMK -25%) get slammed after one of its customers, Natural Molecular Testing, launches their laboratory developed comprehensive Personalized Medicine Panel using Luminex's (LMNX +6%) xMAP technology. Terms of the multi-year collaboration and license agreement were not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • UNXL

    Goldberg Capital discloses it now has a 5.74% stake in UniPixel (UNXL +3.7%). That's up from a...

    Goldberg Capital discloses it now has a 5.74% stake in UniPixel (UNXL +3.7%). That's up from a recent 5.25%, and seems to be giving a lift to shares in the wake of a 61% decline from their April 17 high of $41.42. (13G)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 19 Comments
  • OBE

    Penn West (PWE +3.9%) is poised to break up to boost a valuation that's weaker than 99% of its...

    Penn West (PWE +3.9%) is poised to break up to boost a valuation that's weaker than 99% of its peers, after recently overhauling management, Bloomberg writes. PWE has many high-quality assets, and analysts support separating PWE into two businesses, one focused on assets with growth potential and the other on properties whose predictable production would allow for an attractive dividend.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 6 Comments
  • MNK

    Jefferies analyst Biren Amin weighs in on Questcor (QCOR +21%), saying that some of today's move...

    Jefferies analyst Biren Amin weighs in on Questcor (QCOR +21%), saying that some of today's move has to do with the short interest being around 32% of its float, but adds that its purchase of Synacthen removes an overhang and has the potential to eliminate a competitive threat going forward. For that to happen however, trials from Synacthen and Synacthen Depot in rheumatology, multiple sclerosis, IS and NS will need to demonstrate solid efficacy and safety within the US. Amin maintains a Buy on the shares with a $38 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 9 Comments
  • WRES

    Warren Resources (WRES -2.8%) shares are weak after the energy explorer postponed its debut...

    Warren Resources (WRES -2.8%) shares are weak after the energy explorer postponed its debut issue of $200M of eight-year bonds. The senior notes, rated Caa1 by Moody’s, reportedly were marketed beginning May 30, and were marketed to yield 8.25%-8.5% on June 6. The company says it can be more “opportunistic about timing."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • JEC

    Jacobs Engineering (JEC -1%) says it's been awarded a contract to provide integrated delivery...

    Jacobs Engineering (JEC -1%) says it's been awarded a contract to provide integrated delivery advisor services to the Defence Equipment and Support organization of the United Kingdom Ministry of Defence. The contract value wasn't disclosed, but officals noted that JEC will support the organization's Material Strategy program, which is responsible for administering and managing an equipment and logistics support operation with an annual budget of about $28B for the UK Armed Forces.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • LXRX

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX -3.8%) slips after Morgan Stanley cut the shares to Underweight...

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX -3.8%) slips after Morgan Stanley cut the shares to Underweight and reduces its price target from $2 to $1.50. The firm says it's ratcheting down LX4211 sales/royalties expectations based on its analysis of the internals, which consequently leads to a lower DCF value and a reduced rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 2 Comments
  • SMA

    Symmetry Medical (SMA -15.6%) falls after updating its FY13 outlook. "Based on actual results...

    Symmetry Medical (SMA -15.6%) falls after updating its FY13 outlook. "Based on actual results for May, projected results for June, and the revised forecast for the H2," the company now sees FY13 revenue in the range of $400-415M versus previous guidance of $420-440M. Adjusted EPS should come in between $0.40-0.50 versus consensus of $0.63. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • EMR

    Emerson (EMR -1.2%) subsidiary Emerson Process Management says it's been awarded contracts by...

    Emerson (EMR -1.2%) subsidiary Emerson Process Management says it's been awarded contracts by Chevron Australia to provide control valves and valve actuators to enable the efficient and safe flow of natural gas at the Gorgon Project, one of the world's largest natural gas projects. The contracts, valued at $67M, include more than 1,000 control valves, actuators, and valve controllers, and place EMR as the majority supplier of control and shutdown valves for the project.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • DOLE

    Shares of Dole Food (DOLE +21.3%) move up 21.5% to top the $12 offer price from CEO David...

    Shares of Dole Food (DOLE +21.3%) move up 21.5% to top the $12 offer price from CEO David Murdock as some traders bet another offer will come down the pike. If the script sounds familiar, it's because the 90-year old Murdock has bought and sold Dole before in the past.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • XNPT

    XenoPort (XNPT -5.8%) recovers a bit from its earlier 9% plunge, but still remains firmly in the...

    XenoPort (XNPT -5.8%) recovers a bit from its earlier 9% plunge, but still remains firmly in the red after Morgan Stanley's David Friedman cut the shares to Underweight earlier this morning and lowered his price target to $2. Friedman cites the drug developer's limited pipeline and the recent Phase 3 test failure of its multiple sclerosis treatment arbaclofen placarbil for the downgrade. He notes that sales of Horizant aren't likely to accelerate, and studies for its MS and psoriasis treatment XP23829 are at an early stage with results a long time off.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • PGNX

    Shares of Progenics (PGNX +24.2%) and Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +4.3%) rise after the...

    Shares of Progenics (PGNX +24.2%) and Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +4.3%) rise after the companies announce that the FDA will convene an advisory committee to evaluate an appeal of a complete response letter for Relistor issued last year. The regulator will "seek advice from pain, gastrointestinal, safety and cardiovascular experts," the companies note, adding that they are "optimistic that with the [help of the] FDA and guidance from the Advisory Committee, a path forward" can be found for the drug. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • KGC

    Analysts support Kinross Gold's (KGC -5.2%) decision to give up on the Fruta del Norte project,...

    Analysts support Kinross Gold's (KGC -5.2%) decision to give up on the Fruta del Norte project, seeing the move as freeing up $1.4B for better uses rather than agreeing to Ecuador's tax demands. The move also could signal a higher likelihood that KGC will greenlight the $2.7B Tsasist expansion project in Mauritania.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • JBT

    JBT Corporation (JBT -1%) slips today, despite its earlier announcement that it's received an...

    JBT Corporation (JBT -1%) slips today, despite its earlier announcement that it's received an $8M order from Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center for the supply and integration of automatic guided vehicle products and services. The order includes both upgrading the existing fleet of AGVs at the medical center and delivering additional vehicles to support operations at the new James Cancer Hospital and Solove Research Institute and Critical Care Center.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • LDK

    Volatile solar stocks head south (TAN -4%) after LDK Solar (LDK -8.5%) beat Q1 revenue estimates...

    Volatile solar stocks head south (TAN -4%) after LDK Solar (LDK -8.5%) beat Q1 revenue estimates by $7.1M, but missed EPS forecasts $0.25 thanks to a -57% gross margin (-42.7% exc. a $15.1M inventory write-down), and provided somewhat disappointing revenue guidance. JKS -5.5%. TSL -4.9%. JASO -6.2%. DQ -4.8%. SPWR -4.4%. FSLR -4.9%. YGE -5.2%. GTAT -3.6%. FSLR -4.9%. LDK ended Q1 with $174M in cash, $182M in pledged bank deposits, and a whopping $2.6B in debt. (SolarCity)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • CCE-OLD

    Shares of Coca-Cola Enterprises (CCE-OLD -2.6%) fall after the company warns it's facing...

    Shares of Coca-Cola Enterprises (CCE-OLD -2.6%) fall after the company warns it's facing "challenging" operating conditions in Europe. In particular, a competitive market in Great Britain and sharp excise taxes in France are cited as factors.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • TTWO

    Take-Two (TTWO +2.7%) rallies after canceling investor meetings scheduled for today; the company...

    Take-Two (TTWO +2.7%) rallies after canceling investor meetings scheduled for today; the company says it isn't due to news about products or financial results. Wedbush thinks the game developer (12%-owned by Carl Icahn) could announce a redemption of convertible notes, and thereby remove 12.9M shares from its diluted count. Rival Electronic Arts (EA +1.2%) is also higher on a down day, after unleashing a torrent of game announcements at yesterday's E3 event.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • DATA

    Tableau (DATA -3.8%) and Marketo (MKTO -3.3%) are falling on underwriter coverage day, which...

    Tableau (DATA -3.8%) and Marketo (MKTO -3.3%) are falling on underwriter coverage day, which comes less than 4 weeks after stellar IPOs (I, II). Richly-valued Tableau has received 6 neutral ratings to go with 2 bullish ones, and Marketo has been given 4 bullish and 2 neutral ones. Goldman (Neutral) sees Tableau "leveraging highly differentiated IP and a design-focused product strategy to drive viral growth" in the analytics/data visualization software space, but a valuation of 15.5x 2014E EV/sales is too rich for its blood. Marketo has already been pressured by Salesforce-related worries.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR -3.5%) signs an agreement with South Korea's GS Holdings that could lead to a...

    Petrobras (PBR -3.5%) signs an agreement with South Korea's GS Holdings that could lead to a partnership to build a Brazilian refinery capable of processing ~300K bbl/day of crude starting in late 2017. PBR needs new refineries to keep up with soaring domestic demand for vehicle fuels and petrochemicals, and higher costs have led it to seek partners such as Venezuela's PDVSA and now GS to help build them.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • TSLA

    SolarCity (SCTY -4%) slumps as 61.6M shares become eligible for sale courtesy of a lockup...

    SolarCity (SCTY -4%) slumps as 61.6M shares become eligible for sale courtesy of a lockup expiration. Shares had bounced a little yesterday, but are currently down 34% from their May 20 high of $52.77 (albeit while remaining up 192% YTD), as investors booked gains ahead of the expiration.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • GME

    GameStop (GME +5.6%) opens higher as the market digests the impact of Sony's strategy and...

    GameStop (GME +5.6%) opens higher as the market digests the impact of Sony's strategy and pricing for the PlayStation 4 on the company's business model. The Xbox One and PlayStation 4 news flowing out of E3 has fallen short of some of the dire forecasts on GameStop - even if it's not all that encouraging for the long-term outlook for the used game market.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • VALE

    Vale (VALE -2.6%) sinks to a 52-week low at the open amid concerns about Chinese economic growth...

    Vale (VALE -2.6%) sinks to a 52-week low at the open amid concerns about Chinese economic growth and deteriorating investor sentiment toward Brazil. China is critically important for Vale:Â It's not only the miner's biggest market but also the setter of global benchmark prices for iron ore, which generates virtually all of Vale’s cash flow. Also, Vale must deal with domestic political uncertainties that rival miners don’t.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM

  • The EEM slides 1.9% and the VWO -1.8% premarket amid panicky selling overnight in emerging...

    The EEM slides 1.9% and the VWO -1.8% premarket amid panicky selling overnight in emerging markets. The sector treaded water for most of the year, but began a steep turn downward about one month ago, and is now underperforming the S&P by about 2,400 basis points YTD. There's no premarket action in the DEM, but it's tracking the other 2 popular emerging market ETF plays.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 3 Comments

  • Market preview: Equities, bonds and commodities are selling off globally as markets wonder where...

    Market preview: Equities, bonds and commodities are selling off globally as markets wonder where their next rush of new liquidity will come after the BOJ refrains from adding to its mega-stimulus program and the Fed talks very loudly about tapering QE. The S&P Mini is -0.85%, gold -1% and oil -1.1%, while the 10-year Treasury yield is up 9 bps at 2.25% and eurozone peripheral bond yields spike even more. Later: Wholesale Trade
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • BEAT

    Premarket gainers: BEAT +48%. QCOR +29%. DOLE +22%. CTRX +13%. OTCQB:SURG +9%. GME +5%.Losers:...

    Premarket gainers: BEAT +48%. QCOR +29%. DOLE +22%. CTRX +13%. OTCQB:SURG +9%. GME +5%.
    Losers: LULU -15%. LDK -9%. IRE -6%. STP -6%. KGC -6%. XTEX -5%.Â 
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • XNPT

    A Morgan Stanley downgrade to Underweight weighs on shares of XenoPort (NASDAQ:XNPT) which are...

    A Morgan Stanley downgrade to Underweight weighs on shares of XenoPort (NASDAQ:XNPT) which are off 2.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • LXRX

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:LXRX) slides 4.22% premarket on the heels of a downgrade to...

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:LXRX) slides 4.22% premarket on the heels of a downgrade to Underweight from Equalweight at Morgan Stanley. The company will present tomorrow at the Goldman Sachs Global Healthcare Conference.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • LDK

    More on LDK Solar's (NYSE:LDK) Q1 results: Shipped 240 MW of wafers, 31.4 MW of cells and...

    More on LDK Solar's (NYSE:LDK) Q1 results: Shipped 240 MW of wafers, 31.4 MW of cells and modules. Gross margin was -57% vs. -71.4% in Q4 and -65.5% in Q1 a year ago. Only $174M in cash at end of Q1. Sees Q2 revenues of $100M-150M vs. $138.3M consensus estimate; sees wafer shipments at 250-300 MW and cell and module shipments at 30-40 MW. LDK -10.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • CTRX

    Catamaran (NASDAQ:CTRX) +12.5% premarket after announcing a new 10-year deal with Cigna Monday...

    Catamaran (NASDAQ:CTRX) +12.5% premarket after announcing a new 10-year deal with Cigna Monday evening. The shares get a string of upgrades: UBS, Buy from Neutral; CIBC, Sector Outperform from Sector Perform, PT to $63.75 from $61.51; Raymond James, Outperform from Market Perform, PT $62.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • COCO

    Shares of Corinthian Colleges (NASDAQ:COCO) are now off 26.4% premarket after word that the...

    Shares of Corinthian Colleges (NASDAQ:COCO) are now off 26.4% premarket after word that the company received a subpoena from the SEC creates a wave of selling. The agency is looking into if the company is in compliance with a rule that requires for-profit colleges get no more than 90% of their revenue from federal student-aid programs.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR) acquires the rights to develop the autoimmune drug Synacthen in...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR) acquires the rights to develop the autoimmune drug Synacthen in the U.S. from Novartis (NYSE:NVS) for an upfront payment of $60M. Additional payments of $75M plus certain milestone and royalty payments are expected going forward. QCOR shares +9.9% premarket, NVS is off 0.76%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM | 4 Comments
  • LULU

    A wave of analyst downgrades are coming in on Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) after the resignation of...

    A wave of analyst downgrades are coming in on Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) after the resignation of CEO Christine Day clouded visibility on the retailer and Q1 results (I, II) disappointed. So far, both UBS and Sterne Agee moved to a Neutral stance while BMO expressed concern over the ongoing search for a senior supply chain exec. LULU -13.4% premarket to $71.25.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 AM | 13 Comments
  • DOLE

    Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE) Chairman David Murdock is putting together a bid to buy the business for...

    Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE) Chairman David Murdock is putting together a bid to buy the business for approximately $1.07B, according to the AP. The board will meet over the next few days to consider the offer. DOLE +16.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:09 AM | 3 Comments

  • S&P 500 (SPY) futures -0.8% and Nasdaq 100 (QQQ) -0.9% as markets elsewhere fall sharply...

    S&P 500 (SPY) futures -0.8% and Nasdaq 100 (QQQ) -0.9% as markets elsewhere fall sharply overnight. The Nikkei declined 1.5% and the yen rose 0.6% after the BOJ offers up no new candy and sounds a bit more upbeat on the economy. Europe (FEZ) is off 1.7%. Treasurys continue to slide, the 10-year yield now up to 2.26%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 AM | 4 Comments
  • EZA

    The rout in emerging markets has continued today, with the South African rand (NYSEARCA:EZA)...

    The rout in emerging markets has continued today, with the South African rand (NYSEARCA:EZA) sliding 1.6% to 10.35 to the dollar, the yield on 10-year government bonds jumping 27.5 bps to 8.17%, and the JSE Top 40 sinking 1.8%. Meanwhile, Thai shares lost 4.5%, Indonesia 3.9% and the Philippines 4.6%. (See rupee hits record lows)

  • INR

    The Indian rupee (NYSEARCA:INR) hit a fresh record low of 59 to the dollar earlier today and is...

    The Indian rupee (NYSEARCA:INR) hit a fresh record low of 59 to the dollar earlier today and is down by over 7% since the start of May. The currency has been hit by India's ballooning current-account deficit, the country's economic slowdown, and speculation about the tapering of the Fed's QE program. The rupee's weakness limits the central bank's options to cut interest rates when it meets next week.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 AM | 1 Comment

    As with Japanese shares, European stocks fall after the BOJ offers no new stimulus to satiate markets' liquidity habit. The euro is +0.05% vs the dollar as Germany's top court kicks off a hearing about the legality of the ECB's bond-buying program. EU -0.75%, London -0.7%, Paris -0.6%, Frankfurt -0.8%, Madrid -0.9%, Milan -0.65%.

  • The Nikkei (EWJ) falls 1.4% and the USD-JPY (FXY) is -0.6% after the BOJ announced no new steps...

    The Nikkei (EWJ) falls 1.4% and the USD-JPY (FXY) is -0.6% after the BOJ announced no new steps to curb the volatility in the bond market. Yields on Japanese 10-year bonds are up 3 bps to 0.88%. Real estate stocks were also hit by the BOJ not adding to its purchases of REITs. Hong Kong shares dropped 1.3% ahead of a holiday tomorrow and the re-opening of mainland Chinese exchanges on Thursday. India is -1.4%.
